title_full: SAAS04-BP01 Use siloed services selectively to address cross-tenant performance issues
title: Use siloed services selectively to address cross-tenant performance issues
description: For services critical to performance profile, consider deploying separate instances for each tenant (silo model) while keeping other services shared (pool model). By separating critical services, ensure load of any one tenant won't impact performance of other tenants for that specific service. This approach can increase costs and decrease operational agility but provides targeted cross-tenant performance protection. May also address compliance and isolation requirements.

title_full: SAAS04-BP02 Use container-based scaling for rapid response to tenant load spikes
title: Use container-based scaling for rapid response to tenant load spikes
description: Use container-based architecture with Amazon EKS or Amazon ECS to scale services based on tenant demand without significant over-provisioning. Containers scale rapidly enhancing ability to respond effectively to spikey tenant loads. Combine scaling speed of containers with AWS Fargate for a blend of elasticity, operational agility, and cost efficiency that addresses spikey tenant loads without over-provisioning.

title_full: SAAS04-BP03 Use serverless architectures to align consumption with tenant activity
title: Use serverless architectures to align consumption with tenant activity
description: Use AWS Lambda for serverless SaaS architecture where scaling is managed automatically to address spikey tenant loads. With serverless, your application only incurs charges directly correlated with tenant consumption - no load means no Lambda costs. AWS Fargate provides container-based serverless, charging only for container compute costs actually consumed. Amazon Aurora Serverless sizes your database environment based on actual load. Moving away from scaling policies streamlines operational and cost experience.

title_full: SAAS04-BP04 Minimize gap between infrastructure consumption and tenant activity
title: Minimize gap between infrastructure consumption and tenant activity
description: Create an architecture strategy that scales resource consumption in patterns mirroring real-time, unpredictable patterns of tenant consumption. Track the gap between actual tenant activity and provisioned infrastructure, keeping the gap as small as possible while maintaining cushion for availability and performance. Load in SaaS is often unpredictable - architecture and scaling strategies cannot assume today's load will be the same tomorrow or in the next hour.

title_full: SAAS04-BP05 Use Lambda reserved concurrency to differentiate tier performance
title: Use Lambda reserved concurrency to differentiate tier performance
description: Deploy separate collections of microservices for each tenant tier configured with different Lambda reserved concurrency settings. Basic tier might have reserve concurrency of 100 while Advanced tier has 300. Lower tier consumption is capped, leaving remaining concurrency for premium tier. This aligns with offering best experience to preferred tiers while limiting lower tier ability to consume excess resources and impact higher tier performance.

title_full: SAAS04-BP06 Configure Kubernetes resource quotas and limit ranges for tier-based performance
title: Configure Kubernetes resource quotas and limit ranges for tier-based performance
description: Within Amazon EKS, configure separate ResourceQuotas and LimitRanges to control the amount of resources available in a namespace for different tenant tiers. This allows you to implement tier-based performance differentiation in container-based SaaS architectures, ensuring premium tenants have access to more resources than basic tier tenants.

title_full: SAAS04-BP07 Introduce architectural optimizations for premium tier tenants
title: Introduce architectural optimizations for premium tier tenants
description: Address performance through application design and decomposition strategies. Deploy siloed microservices for higher tier tenants to eliminate noisy neighbor considerations for specific services. Introduce caching of key data for premium tier tenants only, avoiding the expense of supporting caching for all users. The effort for these optimizations should be offset with enough value to the customer and business to warrant the investment.

title_full: SAAS04-BP08 Use throttling policies to control tenant performance by tier
title: Use throttling policies to control tenant performance by tier
description: Introduce throttling policies associated with individual tenant tiers to limit consumption of lower-tiered tenants. As a tenant reaches a limit, apply throttling to control their consumption. This isn't just about maximizing performance - it's also about limiting consumption based on cost or business considerations to ensure the cost footprint of a tenant correlates with their revenue contribution to the business.
